title: ServiceNow Developer (Immediate opportunity)
description:
\*\*Job Description\*\*
We are seeking a skilled and motivated ServiceNow Developer to join our team during a key phase of IT transformation. As we transition from Ivanti Service Manager to ServiceNow, this role will support the implementation project and take long-term ownership of the platform. The successful candidate will ensure the system is optimised, scalable, and aligned with business needs, while also driving continuous improvement and innovation.
\*\*Key Responsibilities\*\*
This list is not exhaustive and may include other duties assigned by the manager.
\* Liaise with internal stakeholders and process owners to gather and understand requirements during requirements gathering sessions.
\* Configure and maintain core ServiceNow modules: Incident, Request, Self-Service, CMDB, and Change Management.
\* Carry out day-to-day administration, including user and group management, roles, and permissions.
\* Develop and maintain workflows, business rules, UI policies, and client scripts.
\* Monitor system performance and ensure data accuracy and integrity.
\* Provide support and training to end-users as required.
\* Lead future enhancements and continuous improvement initiatives.
\* Keep up to date with ServiceNow developments and best practices.
\*\*Required Skills and Experience\*\*
\* 3 to 6 years of hands-on experience as a ServiceNow Developer
\* Demonstrable experience as a ServiceNow Developer in a similar environment.
\* Hands-on expertise with Incident, Request, CMDB, Change, and Self-Service modules.
\* Strong understanding of ITIL processes and service management principles.
\* Experience with ServiceNow configuration and customisation (e.g., workflows, business rules, client/server scripts).
\* Familiarity with access controls, security roles, and permissions.
\* Ability to diagnose and resolve technical issues independently.
\*\*Desirable Skills and Experience\*\*
\* ServiceNow Certified Application Developer.
\* Experience with Ivanti Service Manager (to support the transition).
\* Knowledge of JavaScript for scripting within ServiceNow.
\* Experience with ServiceNow upgrades, patching, and release management.
\* Exposure to system integrations with other platforms or tools.
\* Familiarity with Agile or DevOps working environments.
\*\*Soft Skills\*\*
\* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
\* Ability to collaborate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
\* Proactive and self-driven with a strong problem-solving mindset.
\* Well-organised with good time management skills.
\* Adaptable and open to learning new technologies and processes.
\* Customer-focused with a commitment to delivering high-quality service.

title: ServiceNow Integration Lead
description:
Experience: 810 years Role ServiceNow Lead to drive architecture, design, and delivery of ServiceNow solutions with a strong focus on Supply Chain Management, ITSM, and ITOM. You will lead a team of developers, ensure adherence to best practices, and manage complex integrations.
1. Senior Integration Architect / Technical Lead
Position Overview
We are seeking an experienced Senior Integration Architect to lead the design and implementation of Interos supply chain risk platform integrations with ServiceNow, Coupa, SAP Ariba, and additional enterprise systems. This role requires deep expertise in enterprise integration patterns, supply chain domain knowledge, and technical leadership capabilities to guide a team of 3-4 integration engineers through a strategic multi-phase implementation. Key Responsibilities Lead the technical strategy and architecture design for all Interos integrations across multiple enterprise platforms (ServiceNow, Coupa, SAP Ariba, and others). Serve as the primary technical liaison with Interos, Coupa, ServiceNow, and SAP for technical requirements, API specifications, and integration scenarios. Design end-to-end integration workflows that map supply chain risk data and multi-tier supplier dependencies across platforms. Establish integration patterns, best practices, and coding standards for the integration engineering team. Mentor and guide 3-4 junior/mid-level integration engineers, providing code reviews, technical guidance, and professional development. Work with business stakeholders to translate supply chain risk modeling requirements into technical integration specifications. Oversee the Coupa certification and training program for the team, ensuring all engineers are properly trained and certified. Manage integration project timelines, dependencies, and deliverables to meet the February/March completion target for Phase 1. Troubleshoot complex integration issues across multiple platforms and coordinate solutions with vendor support teams. Document integration architectures, APIs, data mappings, and operational procedures for knowledge transfer and customer handoff. Participate in the customer sales process as technical subject matter expert for Interos-based solutions. Required Qualifications 8+ years of enterprise integration experience, with at least 5 years in a lead or architect role. Advanced expertise in ServiceNow integration development, including REST/SOAP APIs, web services, and JavaScript/Groovy scripting. Proven hands-on experience with Coupa or similar supply chain/procurement platforms (SAP Ariba, Jaggr, Elemica). Deep understanding of supply chain processes, terminology, and multi-tier vendor management concepts. Proficiency with integration middleware platforms (MuleSoft, Dell Boomi, Apache Camel, or equivalent). Strong knowledge of API design, data mapping, ETL processes, and enterprise application integration patterns. Experience designing and managing complex multi-system integration projects with phased rollouts. Demonstrated experience mentoring and leading technical teams (minimum 2 team members). Excellent communication skills with ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions for both technical and non-technical audiences. Preferred Qualifications ServiceNow Certified Application Developer (CAD) or Certified System Administrator (CSA) certification. Coupa Certified Administrator or Developer certification. SAP Ariba integration or administration experience. Coupa Certified Partner Program credentials. Experience with supply chain risk management or procurement analytics solutions. Knowledge of cloud integration platforms and microservices architecture. Experience with Agile project management and CI/CD pipelines. Technical Skills ServiceNow (Platform Development, Integration Hub, Flow Designer, Web Services) Coupa BRM (Business Resource Management) or similar supply chain platforms SAP Ariba and other ERP systems RESTful and SOAP APIs Integration middleware (MuleSoft, Boomi, Camel) JavaScript, Groovy, or similar scripting languages SQL and relational databases XML, JSON, and data transformation API design and documentation Version control (Git) Soft Skills Technical leadership and mentoring Complex problem-solving and analytical thinking Project and stakeholder management Cross-functional collaboration Strategic thinking and architectural design Communication and presentation skills Ability to work under deadline pressure Commitment to continuous learning
